description: Number of standard shifted tableaux with n entries.
references: D. E. Knuth, The art of computer programming, Vol. 3 (Sorting and searching), page 71, Section 5.1.4, Exercise 21 (page 67 in the second edition).
R. Srinivasan, On a theorem of Thrall in combinatorial analysis, The American Mathematical Monthly, 70(1), 1963, pp. 41-44.
R. M. Thrall, A combinatorial problem. Michigan Math. J. 1, (1952). 81-88.
links: Joerg Arndt, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..101
Joerg Arndt, Pari/GP script to compute terms.
R. M. Thrall, A combinatorial problem, Michigan Math. J. 1, (1952), 81-88.
formula: a(n) is the sum over all partitions into distinct parts of Thrall's formula (4) on page 83, see the Pari script arndt-A061343.gp. [_Joerg Arndt_, May 09 2013]
author: V. Reiner and D. White (reiner(AT)math.umn.edu), Jun 07 2001
